result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Kali Madora Rinde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kali Madora Rinde is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kali Madora Rinde was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED****

Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Count 3.
Defendant to report to Probation today May 3, 2016 by 1:00 p.m.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation and Deferred Judgment.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF471.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF471.

-Maintain compliance with treatment plan.
-Complete programming as recommended by Agent.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

timeConds.notes: Condition time to commence November 28, 2016 and be released on January 11, 2017.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Rohan. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Kali Madora Rinde appeared. Case called at 8:46 am. ADA Minser recites agreement. Atty. Caton confirms. Repeater is to be dismissed on Cts 1 and 2. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Cts 1 and 2 without the repeater in both counts on 15CF471. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 15CF471, Court places DEF on Deferred Status for Ct. 1 per Agreement. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 3 in 15CF471. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
-Ct 1 - Deferred Judgment of Conviction - one year 
-Ct 2 - Sent W/H - Probation - one year with conditions:
-Compliance with treatment plan
-Complete programming as recommended by Agent
-Report to probation by 1:00 pm 5/3/16
-DNA sample/Surcharge
-Court Costs
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Eligible for expungement
-Court explains right to appeal
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court will grant if DE is still in treatment, she may appear by phone or in person. If not still in treatment at the time, will need to be here in person.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Kali Madora Rinde appeared.  Case called at 3:44 p.m. Atty Caton requesting a modification of bond or a furlough for AODA. This needs to be completed before she can be admitted to MN Adult Teen Challenge. Recommending sentencing be set for the afternoon of 11-23-2015.  ADA Minser takes no position on the furlough. Just looking to get defendant into the treatment facility. Would like to fashion the sentencing around treatment. Court is given a copy of the revocation order and warrant by Atty Caton to review. ADA Minser will plan on following the recommendations of the probation agent. Atty Caton states as of today, defendant has 41 days credit. Court makes order of modification of bond and is contingent upon Atty Caton cancelling probation hold.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 11:30 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Kali Madora Rinde appeared from jail. Case called at 10:50 a.m. Atty Caton states a Motion to Dismiss was brought up to take under advisement at the initial hearing regarding the repeater charge and gives argument. ADA Minser states that he is not prepared to hear the motion today as a paper motion was never filed and gives argument. Court received a copy of the judgment of convicton from Eau Claire county and the state amends the complaint on the record. ADA Minser calls Officer O'Keefe to the stand. S/T Officer Micheal O'Keefe Deputy with St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA Minser. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Caton. Witness excused. Court finds probable cause was found and binds defendant over for trial. Bond will continue.  Arraignment scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
